body_html:
Now it's a different error. Could you perhaps have created an environment for Python 3 rather 2?
This error occurs when the binary doesn't correspond with the local environment, e.g. different OS, Python version etc.
Also could you try the PYPI package instead sudo -H pip install tensorflow-gpu? Unless I'm missing something here If there's an actual issue with the URL binary you can at least get it going while it's checked.

body:
Now it's a different error. Could you perhaps have created an environment for Python 3 rather 2?
This error occurs when the binary doesn't correspond with the local environment, e.g. different OS, Python version etc.
Also could you try the PYPI package instead `sudo -H pip install tensorflow-gpu`? Unless I'm missing something here If there's an actual issue with the URL binary you can at least get it going while it's checked.
